project.teaser: SMCNetZero brings together six successful urban innovation initiatives in Europe with seven (7) regional and Pan-European networks and their partners to create a Satellite Network of innovation actors to support public sector representatives from Small and Medium-sized cities...
project.objective: SMCNetZero brings together six successful urban innovation initiatives in Europe with seven (7) regional and Pan-European networks and their partners to create a Satellite Network of innovation actors to support public sector representatives from Small and Medium-sized cities (SMCs), SMEs, academia, NGOs and investors across Europe to facilitate decarbonisation in SMCs. SMCNetZero will leverage its diverse Satellite Network to gain an in-depth understanding of SMC needs and barriers; raise awareness and simplify access to existing successful initiatives supporting decarbonisation; support matchmaking between supply and demand sides by linking SMEs, researchers, and investors with SMCs; and help identify and open access to funding for enabling innovation deployment in SMCs currently underrepresented in the European innovation ecosystem. SMCNetZero is unique in that its diverse consortium partners and broad commitment from target stakeholders in the Satellite Network ensure focus in regions with less innovation capacity, with written confirmed commitment from nearly 100 innovation actors at the proposal stage, to participate in the activities - including an emphasis on largely underrepresented regions and stakeholders. SMCNetZero’s vision is to create and strengthen local innovation ecosystems’ interrelations in SMCNetZero regions through brokerage and knowledge-building activities as well as digital resources to increase capacity for planning, deploying and scaling-up of decarbonisation solutions, overall focusing on increasing the inclusivity of these innovation ecosystems and minimizing existing innovation divides.
project.title: Achieving Net-Zero through Innovation in Small and Medium sized Cities
project.keywords: Climate Neutrality, Net Zero, Small and medium sized cities, Investors, SMEs

result.title: Medium blog articles x 4
result.description: A Medium blog article series of 4 articles covering topics around green, digital and social transitions for SMCs.

result.title: Matchmaking and Innovation Activities Overview
result.description: A short report for each of the matchmaking tracks will be made including the challenge descriptions participants and the outcome of 3 innovation workshops

result.title: Project Newsletters
result.description: Newsletters will be published and disseminated to the SMCNetZero network once every three months to engage with and keep various actors connected to the project informed. All Digital Forum and Satellite Networks Group participants will automatically be identified to receive the newsletter, with other actors openly invited both directly and via the project website to subscribe.

result.title: Capacity Building Activity Report
result.description: A report that summarises the different capacity building activities.

result.title: Market Analysis Report
result.description: A report including the results of the market analysis A document detailing the guidelines will be created in M1 to be followed by all the participants to address the market analysis in their respective regions

result.title: Action Launchpad Report
result.description: A report focusing on the practice and learning of action taken for Mis, serving as a blueprint for other application to other potential topics. Will include the theory of how activities and action will be coordinated looking across all WPs (including, e.g. market consultation materials and review of all activities) specific to MIs and second focusing on the practice and learning of what was done and blueprint for other potential topics.

result.title: Podcast episodes x 6
result.description: A podcast series of 6 episodes with interviews investigating solutions to challenges regarding the green and digital transition of SMCs.

result.title: Decarbonisation Toolkit of 5 tools
result.description: A collection of at least 5 digitalised tools – 4 identified from existing projects and the new Funding Finder tool – available within the Digital Forum.

result.title: Mobility Island Proof Point
result.description: A specific capture of the accomplishments of the network of cities in connection to MIs – including benefits and learning points for all parties.

result.title: 4 Innovation Capacity Building trainings hosted
result.description: A series of hybrid Smart City training events for SMCs. Confirmation letters provided to participants for attending the training.

result.title: Catalogue of experience and best practices for matchmaking and collaboration activities at the organisational level
result.description: Based on knowledge sharing between the consortium partners, a catalogue describing best practices and ideas on innovation and collaboration building within and cross-border ecosystems will be created.

result.title: SMCNetZero Digital Forum
result.description: An online space housed within the existing BABLE Smart Cities platform to facilitate interaction and collaboration between various innovation ecosystem actors in SMCs aiming to address challenges bridge gaps and inspire new solutions

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SMCNetZero (Achieving Net-Zero through Innovation in Small and Medium sized Cities)
result.teaser: SMCNetZero is an 18-month project focusing on creating and strengthening local innovation ecosystems in SMCs and creating a Satellite Network of innovation actors including public sector representatives from Small and Medium-sized cities (SMCs), SMEs, academia, NGOs, and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Catalogue of 50 SMC innovation ecosystem best practices (Use Cases) and Solutions toward decarbonisation
result.description: A catalogue embedded within the Digital Forum to provide rich information on best practices implemented by SMCs showcasing reallife implementation stories from SMCs and SMEs and a guide embedded within the Digital Forum focused on the topic of Mobility Islands and providing a componentbased inventory of suppliers incl SMEs that can offer various features of the solution for buyers

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
